trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents the fully qualified path of the directory or file.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The fully qualified path is 260 or more characters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx 000 xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The path originally specified by the user, whether relative or absolute.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the attributes for the current file or directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The specified file does not exist.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The specified path is invalid; for example, it is on an unmapped drive.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller does not have the required permission.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller attempts to set an invalid file attribute.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
-or-

The user attempts to set an attribute value but does not have write permission.
trans-unit.target: $$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the creation time of the current file or directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The specified path is invalid; for example, it is on an unmapped drive.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current operating system is not Windows NT or later.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxx XX xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller attempts to set an invalid creation time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the creation time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), of the current file or directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx $XXX$$ xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The specified path is invalid; for example, it is on an unmapped drive.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current operating system is not Windows NT or later.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxx XX xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller attempts to set an invalid access time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the file or directory exists.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the file or directory exists; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the full path of the directory or file.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A string containing the full path.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The fully qualified path and file name is 260 or more characters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx 000 xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller does not have the required permission.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the time the current file or directory was last accessed.

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current operating system is not Windows NT or later.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The caller attempts to set an invalid access time

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), that the current file or directory was last accessed.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

trans-unit.source:

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

\n

\n

The caller attempts to set an invalid write time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

For files, gets the name of the file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: For directories, gets the name of the last directory in the hierarchy if a hierarchy exists.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Otherwise, the Name property gets the name of the directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxxx$ xxx $xxxxxx$Xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A string that is the name of the parent directory, the name of the last directory in the hierarchy, or the name of a file, including the file name extension.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxx xx x xxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Deletes a file or directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The specified path is invalid; for example, it is on an unmapped drive.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$ xx xx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

There is an open handle on the file or directory, and the operating system is Windows XP or earlier.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx XX xx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: This open handle can result from enumerating directories and files.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
For more information, see How to: Enumerate Directories and Files.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx$ xxx Xxx xx$ Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxxx xxx Xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Refreshes the state of the object.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A device such as a disk drive is not ready.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxx xx x xxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx.
